div.pre: 2006 Taranto, Calabria, 1883 (1046) Burial: 228 B.C. Contents: 1557 AR Taras: 1016 st. (47 Per. VII; 917 Per. VIII; 52 Per. IX A-C, E-F) 520 fr. Thurium: 21 st. (reduced weight: 14 Athena/bull; 7 Apollo/bull) Disposition: Taranto, the majority; Evans 300, from which Jameson 7 (Cat. 217-223) and Vlasto 9 (Cat. 771, 938, 940-2, 947, 961 ?, 963, 969). It is likely that most of the examples of Per. VII- IX in SNGOxford recorded as bought by Oxford from Evans in 1885 were from this hd., as well as SNG 999-1003 and 1008 (all Thurium, ex Evans) Evans, NC 1889, pp. 165-9, 219-28 The Jameson Cat. records nos. 217-23 as ex Evans, "Trouvaille de Tarente 1887." Noe took this to refer to his no. 505 (= no. 1917 above); this, however, is an early 4th cent. hd. Since the coins are all of Per. IX and were acquired from Evans, 1887 is certainly a mistake for 1883. Vlasto Cat. no. 961 is mistakenly attributed to N. 1058, the 4th cent. "Molossian find;" for a similar confusion con- cerning N. 1058, see no. 1984 above
